title: @Riot Are any Characters in Warmother being considered to become Champions? [Minor Spoilers]
body:
Now I know it's really early to make such a request but honestly I'd love to see Maalcrom as an in game support, a kind hearted person wielding dark powers, and just like Leona was a good female addition to tanks I feel like Maalcrom would be a good male addition to a primarily female role of enchanters. Honestly thus far he's probably my second favorite character in the entire comic so I'd love to know.

Alternatively, I know there's a good chance that Grena wont make it all the way until the end of the story but I'd give the world to see this badass grandma in the game to kick ass as a dominant lane bully. her unique weapons and amazing dialog really make me want to see her in game. even her title of the Blizzard and the Lightning sounds so cool and has so much potential for abilities, like her auto attacks having a Tiamat like passive to make her auto attacks branch out around her target in a sweep of ice and snow coming from each sweeping attack of her mighty Axe.

TL;DR
I love these characters, their abilities and their personalities so I hope some I really hope they're being considered to be full fledged characters some day.

Maalcrom is a male enchanter of which the closest thing in terms of design we have is Taric (who is the only Male enchanting support for some reason!) but also brings some nice design elements with his Dark/Night Magic on a still very compassionate character and dear god do I love that tribal design..

Grena has her own unique set of weapons which could make for some fun gameplay along with her amazing personality and design which seems to somewhat blend Braum and Illaoi (two of my all time favorite champions so I'm very bias on this) ready to solve any problem with her firsts, always pushing everyone to give things their all but also kind and caring in her interactions with ashe. But honestly I love her design too, being a musclebound woman (of which we only have Illoai and maybe Rek'sai thus far) I think she could make for a great addition to the cast.

Don't get me wrong, I think the all the character designs in that comic were unique and awesome, but I don't think they would add those exact characters to the game. Sejuani is the first that comes to mind when I think of battle-ready, strong woman from the Frejlord, so I don't think they would ever double dip into that.

As for Maalcrom, again, I see them adding someone _like_ him, but not Maalcrom himself. It would be more logical to save that archetype to build the world more rather than using a character already in their creative ecosystem. There is an island west of the Frejlord and a large frozen mass to the north. If anything I would think they would make a totally unique character from one of those regions before using a specific character that has established interactions.

Also, he was already shown to not be very powerful considering Grena almost killed him.
except that he's just a random human mage and she's an iceborn, and he was still able to withstand her attack before Ashe stepped in to stop her mother.

I read somewhere where a Rioter said NPCs that have true names (not titles) will never become champions. I don’t have the source unfortunately but it was in a thread asking for Tamara to become a champion.

I doubt that's something they'll completely stick to. The only current candidate with only a title and not a name is The Ruined King, at least that I can think of. And they should consider at least *some* side characters that can be fleshed out as champions. For example, wasn't Jarvan originally a side character in Garen's lore and then became a new champion? Also, not quite the same situation, but Graves was kind of created as a side character to Twisted Fate.
